case_vignette: A 6-year-old boy presents to the pediatrician with his parents. He fully vaccinated and met most developmental milestones. His fine motor milestones are delayed; at present, he cannot eat by himself and has difficulty in self-dressing. His intelligence quotient (IQ) is 65. He listens quietly while spoken to and engages in play with his classmates. He neither talks excessively nor remains mute, but engages in normal social conversation. There is no history of seizures and he is not on any long-term medical treatment. On his physical examination, his vital signs are stable. His height and weight are normal for his age and sex, but his occipitofrontal circumference is less than the 3rd percentile for his age and sex. His neurologic examination is also normal.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

I have trouble eating by myself and difficulties with dressing up on my own.

I'm a 6-year-old boy.

No, I haven't had any medical issues or illnesses in the past.

No, I'm not on any long-term medical treatment.
Do you have any family history of similar conditions?
The information about family history of similar conditions isn't provided.
Final Diagnosis: Autism Spectrum Disorder.
